content:
I'm trying to find a folder in MathLib that contains the theorems I'm learning in my undergraduate course. This could contain theorems about sequences and series, the topology of \R, and/or functional limits (I was specifically looking for the proof of the mean and intermediate value theorems in the reals when I went looking).
It seems like these are not categorized how I thought and that everything I'm looking for is pretty spread out. Does anyone have any tips for finding such specific theorems for an undergrad who doesn't know the more generalized theorems? Do they even exist to such specific degrees?
One approximation to this is the undergrad list page. But really you should not hope that Mathlib will be easy to read if you know only elementary mathematics, it is not its goal.
Rowan Williams has marked this topic as resolved.
@Josha Dekker, you might have something to say
Type a summary of the theorem you're looking for into moogle.ai

Besides what has been mentioned already, I’m working on something that aims to link all the results in one book to Mathlib declarations, to improve this searchability. As I’m still figuring out how to do this optimally and I’m quite busy, progress on this is slow. The first book is Bourbaki’s General Topology, which is not exactly an introductory text. At some point there will hopefully be a similar effort with a text on analysis with the same purpose.
